title: 113_s1415
content: The Act is titled the "Canyon Mountain Land Conveyance Act of 2013" and includes definitions. The Act titled the "Canyon Mountain Land Conveyance Act of 2013" defines "Federal land" as approximately 17,826 acres depicted on a specific map and "planning area" as land administered by the Bureau of Land Management in various districts. The Act defines public domain land as public lands in specific districts, excluding certain areas. The Policy and Management Act of 1976 excludes land managed under a specific 1937 Act from the definition of public domain land. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the Tribe refers to the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians. The Policy and Management Act of 1976 excludes specific land from public domain. The Secretary will survey and convey Federal land to the Tribe, holding it in trust for their benefit. The Secretary will survey and convey Federal land to the Tribe, holding it in trust for their benefit, as outlined in Section 4 which includes a map and legal description. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of the Federal land with the Senate and House Committees, with the same force and effect as if included in the Act, allowing for corrections of errors. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of the Federal land with the Senate and House Committees, with the same force and effect as if included in the Act, allowing for corrections of errors. The map and legal description filed shall be available for public inspection in the Office of the Secretary. The administration of the Federal land will be overseen by the Secretary, who will file a map and legal description with the Senate and House Committees for public inspection. The Act does not affect the Tribe's existing land rights. Federal law applies to the export of unprocessed logs from Federal land. Land taken into trust cannot be used for gaming activities under Public Law 100-497. SEC. 6. FOREST MANAGEMENT. Commercial forestry on Federal land must comply with all applicable Federal laws. SEC. 7. LAND RECLASSIFICATION. The Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary must identify Oregon and California Railroad land to be conveyed under the Act within 180 days. Public domain land of similar acreage and condition within the planning area must be identified within 18 months. Maps must be provided within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Secretary must identify Oregon and California Railroad land to be conveyed within 180 days. Public domain land of similar acreage and condition within the planning area must be identified within 18 months. Maps depicting the identified land must be submitted to Congress and published within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Secretary shall reclassify the identified land as land owned by the Oregon and California Railroad after providing an opportunity for public comment. The Act of August 28, 1937 shall apply to the reclassified land. The Act of August 28, 1937 applies to land reclassified as owned by the Oregon and California Railroad.
